verses.verse: Do not trust in oppression, Nor vainly hope in robbery; (Job 31:25; (Mark 10:24; Luke 12:15; 1 Tim. 6:10)) If riches increase, Do not set your heart on them.
God has spoken once, Twice I have heard this: That power belongs to God.
Also to You, O Lord, belongs mercy; For ((Matt. 16:27); Rom. 2:6; 1 Cor. 3:8) You render to each one according to his work.

(Joy in the Fellowship of God) A Psalm of David (1 Sam. 22:5) when he was in the wilderness of Judah. [1] O God, You are my God; Early will I seek You; (Ps. 42:2; (Matt. 5:6)) My soul thirsts for You; My flesh longs for You In a dry and thirsty land Where there is no water.
So I have looked for You in the sanctuary, To see (Ps. 27:4) Your power and Your glory.
(Ps. 138:2) Because Your lovingkindness is better than life, My lips shall praise You.
Thus I will bless You while I live; I will (Ps. 28:2; 143:6) lift up my hands in Your name.
My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness, And my mouth shall praise You with joyful lips.
When (Ps. 42:8) I remember You on my bed, I meditate on You in the night watches.
Because You have been my help, Therefore in the shadow of Your wings I will rejoice.
